name: baiting
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
used to form nouns and adjectives that describe the act of intentionally trying to make a particular person or group of people angry by saying things to annoy, offend, or criticize them: a celebrity-baiting newspaper columnist The comedian liked to indulge in a bit of media-baiting. See also
race-baiting
More examplesFewer examplesHe sees himself as an Establishment-baiting comedian.Morgan Spurlock is the film-maker behind the McDonald's-baiting "Super Size Me".He plays an audience-baiting ringmaster in a Union-flag waistcoat, top hat and tails. One of their best tracks is the simmering, church-baiting "Intervention".Antonio in the play is especially persistent in Jew-baiting. What did this week's top two most feminist-baiting opinion columns have in common?
